intro: Chamaesyce inaequilatera, commonly known as the unequal-armed sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Americas and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically oval or elliptic with toothed margins, and it thrives in sandy or disturbed soils. Chamaesyce inaequilatera is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, making it an adaptable species in harsh conditions.
